name: v1.8.3
body: Fixed check for introns when deletion and insertion are next to each other at the end of the read.

name: Release 1.6
body: Major code refactoring, several optimizations, and bugfixes

name: Release 1.5.8
body:
Fixing null pointer exception on edge case.
Othe improvements and bugfixes.

name: Release 1.5.7
body:
- Fixed: Somdict output and NM negative value changes 
- Mismatches, vext changes from the last commit in Perl repo
- Fix for NPE in NM join to output
- Fixed: Skipping indels after introns
- Improved: Very high quality values in BAM files (collapsed consensus reads)

name: Release 1.5.6
body:
- SV variants being reported when '--nosv' was set
- Fixed negative values on coverage, breaking Fisher tests downstream
- Added filter for variants within BED intervals (only show variants if their 5'end lands on the interval of interest).

name: Release 1.5.5
body: Main feature: SVs

name: Fix for excessive reference file openings, updated htsdk version to 2.8
body:
Fixed problem with excessive reference file openings. Used the same approach as with SamReader.

Also updated htsjdk version to 2.8 and JDK to 1.8.

name: Release 1.4.7:  bugfix, performance and resource usage improvement
body:
Fixed problem revealed in issue https://github.com/AstraZeneca-NGS/VarDictJava/issues/56 (VarDict Amplicon Mode throws IndexOutOfBoundsException).  Solution: Mapped reads are skipped now (See https://github.com/AstraZeneca-NGS/VarDictJava/commit/ca0acbb6308ff35cf31b9b14c98b65f49d4ac7b2 )

Performance and Resource usage Improvement.

VarDict created new SAMReader for each interval from input .bed file. Recreating the same readers treating file system thousands of times is not supposed way of using SamReaderFactory. In some environment it might cause problems due to heavy file system interaction. Anyway, multiple recreating of the same object is not efficient in terms of performance.

We cache Readers for each thread of VarDict now.  It leads to the restriction that the only SamView object must be created per thread (and only after the previous one is closed). The is no such a case in VarDict.

Apart from resolving file system interaction problems, Readers caching shows better resources utilization and speeds up overall work. Our tests show up to 30% speedup on some cases (the best results are shown in single-threaded mode).

body:
- Increased the size of the heap by default to 8g in start script
- Added last Zhongwu's improvements in variant amplicon
- Fixed a bug: Option 'I' had a wrong type
- Fixed issue #13: Added command-line option 'VS'
